data.title: What is Al Murray's net worth, when did he create The Pub Landlord and who has he been married to before?
data.meta_description: COMEDIAN Al Murray became a household name thanks to his alter-ego The Pub Landlord - and has since amassed a fortune.But, exactly how much money has
data.text:
COMEDIAN Al Murray became a household name thanks to his alter-ego The Pub Landlord - and has since amassed a fortune.

But, exactly how much money has Al made? We get the lowdown on one of the country's favourite funnymen.

What is Al Murray's net worth?

Exact details of Al Murrary's net worth aren't known, but the 49-year-old he has made millions.

Back in 2013, he came in at number 14 in a list of the UK's 20 highest earning comedians. That year, he'd earned a cool £1 million.

He's also bulked up his earnings with a string of best selling DVDs, including:

Live - My Gaff, My Rules

...And A Glass of White Wine for the Lady!

Giving It Both Barrels: Live

Live at the London Palladium

Beautiful British Tour: Live at the O2

Barrel of Fun: Live

The Only Way Is Epic

One Man, One Guvnor

And, bagging him even more money, he's published 5 books:

The Pub Landlord's Book of British Common Sense

The Pub Landlord's Think Yourself British

The Pub Landlord's Great British Pub Quiz Book

Watching War Films with My Dad

Let's Re-Great Britain

When did Al Murray create The Pub Landlord?

He debuted The Pub Landlord at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe in 1994. He appeared alongside Harry Hill and and Matthew Bradstock-Smith in the show Pub Internationale.

Murray's theatre show My Gaff, My Rules - where he appeared in character as The Pub Landlord - was short-listed for a Laurence Olivier Award in 2002.

He has also appeared in character as The Pub Landlord in the series Time Gentlemen Please, as well as a number of other television appearances, including the An Audience with... strand.

As The Pub Landlord, Al has hosted several television programmes including Fact Hunt, Live at the Apollo and Dave's Compete for the Meat, which is co-hosted by Zöe Salmon, and ITV chat show Al Murray's Happy Hour, which won a British Comedy Award for Best New Entertainment Comedy.

What other shows has he been in?

Away from his Pub Landlord alter-ego, Al has appeared in various TV shows as himslef.

In 2003, Murray appeared on an episode of the BBC's Time Commanders. In 2004, he appeared as a contestant in the first series of Gordon Ramsay's reality show Hell's Kitchen and in 2005 as a contestant on Comic Relief Does Fame Academy.

He has also presented Al Murray's Road to Berlin on the Discovery Channel, starred in Al Murray's Multiple Personality Disorder, a sketch show, which aired in early 2009.

He also made a documentary on German culture for BBC4, Al Murray's German Adventure, in which he presented a different side of the German nation from the one portrayed by The Pub Landlord.

He's also appeared on Top Gear as the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

Who are his ex-wives?

Al has been married twice, and currently separated from his second wife.

He was married to Katherine Perry from 1995–2000 and to Amber Hargreaves from 2002 until their separation in 2008. The couple have two daughters together, Scarlett and Willow.

At the time, Amber told The Sun: "It's just one of those really sad things. There's no one else involved and it's very amicable.

"We still love and respect each other a lot. We've got little people, so we're trying to do our best by them."
